title: 106_s986
content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act defines the "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and the "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized under the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. The term "Acquired Land(s)" refers to all interests in land acquired for the Griffith Project under Public Law 89-292, including fee title, right(s)-of-way, and easement(s). The term "Secretary" in this context means the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Public Land" refers to lands under Federal ownership managed by the Bureau of Land Management. "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands reserved for specific public purposes under certain laws and managed by either the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights and interests in the project to the Authority. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights and interests in the project to the Authority, including improvements, facilities, acquired lands, and reserved interests in lands patented by the United States. The Authority will have a right-of-way at no cost across all Public Land and Withdrawn Land. The Authority will have a right-of-way across Federal lands for the Griffith Project's operation, maintenance, and repair without payment. Within twelve months, the Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description for the established rights-of-way. The Secretary will deliver a document memorializing the rights-of-way to the Authority. If the conveyance has not occurred within twelve months, a report on the status will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and permits to comply with this Act. This Act does not affect other laws or future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, all applicable laws and regulations must be followed. The lands and facilities transferred will no longer receive Reclamation benefits as a Federal Reclamation Project. The Griffith Project will no longer be a Federal Reclamation Project, but Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected. Federal reclamation law will still apply to water delivered to the Authority. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project and acquired interests, the United States will not be liable for any damages related to its prior ownership.
